intro: Trichosanthes leishanensis, commonly known as the Leishan bitter melon, is a vine native to China. It belongs to the Cucurbitaceae family, which includes cucumbers and pumpkins. The plant produces large, elongated fruits with a bitter taste, often used in traditional Chinese medicine. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with five petals. The fruit is typically harvested when it is still green, though it can ripen to a yellow or orange color.
